lines.content: - AI quickly generated appropriate test structure with minimal guidance
- Generated assertions that match the expected behavior of each command
- Initial generation required some context about task classes to ensure correct test assertions
- Estimated ~30-40 minutes saved compared to manual test writing
- Would have taken 45-60 minutes manually, completed in ~5 minutes with AI assistance
**Increment:** Added comprehensive Javadoc comments to all public classes and methods
- Estimated ~45-60 minutes saved writing Javadoc for all classes and methods
**Increment:** Visual improvements to the JavaFX interface
- Added background image with transparent chat bubbles themed to Charmander (user) and Squirtle (bot)
- Restyled input bar with pill-shaped text field and round send button
- Reduced avatar size and aligned it with the chat bubble
- Made window resizable with content reflowing correctly
- Custom scrollbar with transparent track and semi-transparent thumb via CSS
- Reformatted help output into a readable list
- AI accurately translated design intent into concrete FXML/CSS/Java changes
- Iterative refinements (opacity, button icon, bubble transparency) were applied quickly with no regressions
- First attempt at the background used `this` instead of the injected `mainPane` node, requiring a follow-up fix
- Estimated ~2 hours saved on manual FXML/CSS trial-and-error
This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after my favourite colour _Blue_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Launcher.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Launcher.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see the Blue chat window.

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.

**Blue** is a personal task manager chatbot with a no-nonsense attitude. Type commands in plain text and Blue keeps track of your todos, deadlines, and events.
2. Download the latest `blue.jar` from the Releases page.
4. Type a command and press **Send** (or Enter).
5. Type `help` at any time for a command summary.
Blue tracks three types of tasks:
| `[T]` | Todo | A task with no date |
| `[D]` | Deadline | A task due by a specific date/time |
| `[E]` | Event | A task spanning a start and end date/time |
A `[ ]` means the task is not done; `[X]` means it's done.
Adds a simple task with no date attached.
Adds a task that must be completed by a specific date and time.
Adds a task with a start and end time.
Shows everything currently on the board, numbered in order.
Marks one or more tasks as completed. Use the numbers shown in `list`.
Multiple task numbers can be given, space-separated.
Reverses a mark, setting tasks back to not done.
Permanently removes one or more tasks from the board.
Searches task descriptions for a keyword (case-insensitive).
Prints a quick command reference inside the chat.
Closes the application. Your tasks are already saved — nothing extra needed.
- Tasks are **saved automatically** after every change to `data/blue.txt`.
- Data persists between sessions — just reopen the app and your board is restored.
- If the save file is missing or corrupted, Blue starts fresh with an empty board.
- Descriptions **cannot contain commas** (commas are used internally for storage).
- If you add a task identical to one already on the board, Blue will warn you instead of adding a duplicate.
- Task numbers refer to the current `list` order — always check `list` before using `mark`, `unmark`, or `delete`.
